collections.title: Asset Collections
collections.description: This site showcases 3D asset collections with clear licenses and sources:

original.title: Polygonal Mind Collections (CC0)
original.name: 17 themed collections – 991+ free 3D assets
original.license: License: CC0 (Public Domain) – use however you want, no attribution needed
original.includes: Includes: GLB files, props, environments, structures

community.title: More Collections
community.note: Additional CC0 and open-license 3D collections may be added over time. Check the Asset Browser for current listings.

collections.licenseNote: License matters! CC0 assets can be used freely without credit. CC-BY assets require attribution. Always check the collection details.

database.title: Asset Database (GitHub)
database.description: Access all asset metadata as JSON files – perfect for integrating into your app or game.

website.title: Website Source Code
website.description: The gallery website is open source.

glb.title: About GLB Format
glb.description: GLB is the binary glTF format used for 3D models, props, and environments.

why.title: Why we use GLB:
reasons: Works in Blender, Unity, Unreal, Three.js, and most 3D tools
Open Khronos standard – not locked to one vendor
Single-file: model and materials in one file

ardrive.title: What is ArDrive?
ardrive.description: ArDrive is permanent, decentralized storage built on Arweave.

why.title: Why it matters:
reasons: Files stored forever (can't be deleted or taken offline)
Perfect for preserving open source content

ardrive.note: Some asset sources may use ArDrive or IPFS for permanent storage. Our main registry is the open-source-3D-assets GitHub repository.

philosophy.title: Open Source Philosophy
philosophy.description: We believe 3D assets should be free and accessible.
philosophy.why: That's why we highlight CC0 (public domain) collections:
benefits: ✅ Use in games, apps, VR, and artwork
philosophy.note: Collections have their own licenses – we make these easy to find so you know what you can do with each asset.
philosophy.conclusion: The 3D ecosystem should be built on open standards, not locked behind paywalls.

help.title: Need Help?
help.questions: Questions about licenses? Check the collection details on each asset page.
help.building: Building something? Our JSON data is free to use – build your own asset browser!
help.contribute: Want to contribute? Submit your collection via GitHub.
